de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.algorithms.voronoi

Class VoronoiRelaxation

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.algorithms.voronoi.VoronoiRelaxation

  • public class VoronoiRelaxation
extends java.lang.Object
    Lloyd's algorithm, also known as Voronoi iteration or relaxation, is an algorithm named after Stuart P. Lloyd for finding evenly spaced sets of points in subsets of Euclidean spaces and partitions of these subsets into well-shaped and uniformly sized convex cells. 
     Lloyd, Stuart. "Least squares quantization in PCM."
 IEEE transactions on information theory 28.2 (1982): 129-137.
    See Also:
    Least squares quantization in PCM.

      • relax

        public static java.util.List<Vector2D> relax(VoronoiDiagram diagram)
        Computes one iteration of lloyd's relaxation. Creates a new relaxed diagram.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The Voronoi diagram after relaxation.
